column1: Three years ago. Another reminder why Betsy DeVos should never have been confirmed to be Secretary of Education. https://t.co/Krv5IH7R02

In Michigan and across the country folks are concerned about how they can afford the health care their families need.  No one in America should have to choose between life-saving prescription drugs or paying rent. https://t.co/4ccdjlnitK
Michigan women are a powerful force and incredible leaders. #WomensMarch https://t.co/UBRftQFnce

Through my dad a middle school teacher I saw firsthand the impact education can have.  It shouldn’t matter if you want to go to a four-year university or a trade school and it shouldn’t matter where you live -- a quality affordable education should be accessible for everyone. https://t.co/03JB0OS7kY

Pets are part of the family. For many domestic abuse survivors the difficult choice to leave becomes that much harder if pets can’t come with you.  That’s why I championed the PAWS Act to expand pet-friendly shelters and stand up for survivors. https://t.co/tfVdbmovtz
This is outrageous.  Michigan cherry growers are some of the hardest workers in the country and they deserve an equal playing field against cheating foreign actors. https://t.co/kmRrLF8E5e
I'm fighting to lower the cost of prescription drugs because no one should have to choose between paying for medicine and putting food on the table.https://t.co/hxwaWubQVs
Tonight's #DemDebate reminds me that as important as the presidency is we also have to flip the Senate.  That can’t happen without protecting my seat in Michigan. Donate now: https://t.co/B8tx4eJoVC
Extreme weather can have devastating consequences for Michigan businesses and our economy.  That's why we literally cannot afford inaction on climate change. https://t.co/2ZMwM1XCv6
Students and families are worse off because of Betsy DeVos. https://t.co/6gzqEoIzCJ
Only in Michigan. https://t.co/dR6qtixk0o

I've teamed up with community leaders and residents to take on polluters who make our state less healthy.  I'm committed to continuing this work because your zip code shouldn't determine your life expectancy. https://t.co/yjxET6KdgA

The voices that are often left out of the conversation when it comes to pollution are many times the people who experience it directly.  Environmental justice needs to be part of our fight against climate change. https://t.co/7rNyHAXeuK
Whether standing up for our Great Lakes or expanding skills training I'll always put Michigan first. https://t.co/bMqjzU90jy
The Great Lakes are the central part of our economy and way of life and we have to act now to protect them and the communities that rely on them. https://t.co/s1y0poDnW1
Thankful for brave Michiganders like Brian who answered the call to help battle the #AustralianWildfires. Stay safe -- and thank you for your service. https://t.co/Oj6QaPdkEA
The consequences of climate change will hit Michigan and the Great Lakes hard. We can't afford to ignore this crisis. https://t.co/Dq5yIEyeZo
Colleen and I are sad to hear of the passing of Jack Faxon. He was a model public servant whose dedication to his constituents won’t be forgotten. https://t.co/FT5S55PRnk
I went to junior high with @Madonna. https://t.co/ePvPFaBqtV
Couldn’t agree more. Nothing beats Michigan. https://t.co/ioZSogxG9W
This is huge -- these equipment upgrades and improvements will support Michigan's economy.  Proud to have supported Port of Monroe in their grant application. https://t.co/f3v9H2Gbt9
Standing up for Michigan means standing up for the Great Lakes and the communities around them. https://t.co/70gfj8Q8Nt

Excited to announce that we had our best fundraising quarter ever! Thank you to everyone who pitched in and supported our campaign to keep delivering results for Michigan. It’s folks like you who will make sure we’re successful in November! https://t.co/JacLcpGykh

I’m also proud to say we collected signatures from all 83 counties in Michigan. I’ve always been focused on delivering for the people of this state no matter where they live. This outpouring of support from all parts of Michigan is both humbling and inspiring. Thank you!

Today I officially filed to be on the #MISen ballot! We couldn't have done this without the hundreds of volunteers who gave their time and effort to collect signatures and canvass across the state. Together I know we’re going to be successful this November!

The recent anti-Semitic attacks and attacks on places of worship are horrifying. Whether at home church synagogue or mosque everyone should be able to worship safely and free of fear. https://t.co/2ub4YGItVo

Very sorry to hear about the passing of Allee Willis. A Detroit native she was a gifted songwriter with an incredibly kind spirit. She will be dearly missed but I know her music will continue to bring joy to so many for years to come. https://t.co/AwafSiAnrU
Merry Christmas from my family to yours! Wishing you and your loved ones a day filled with happiness and good cheer. 🎄 https://t.co/4sFmKBIyfa
Wishing a very happy #Hanukkah to everyone celebrating tonight! May this Festival of Lights bring blessings of health and happiness to you and your loved ones.
John Dingell was a mentor and Debbie Dingell is my friend. To disrespect them is to disrespect the state of Michigan.   https://t.co/NGgsvO5TJy
I'm all for getting more students interested in careers in the skilled trades. They're solid jobs and the backbone of Michigan's economy. https://t.co/jzGY5NaAPX
This is all you need to know to figure out who really benefited from the #GOPTaxScam https://t.co/ZPi2rW6I7L

All eyes are going to be on us in 2020. If we want any chance to take back the Senate we've got to make sure we win here in Michigan. https://t.co/yvUCo7XiA0
Who is ready for some college basketball tonight? Good luck to @umichbball and @MSU_Basketball on their games in the #B1GACC Challenge!

1.7 million Michiganders have a pre-existing condition. The White House is suing to gut their health care protections:   "If the lawsuit succeeds protections for people with pre-existing conditions would be wiped from the books."  https://t.co/dBZooh72NH

In the Senate I've focused on keeping our first responders safe and our water clean. Reducing the use of dangerous chemicals like PFAS is an important step in the right direction. https://t.co/gysSifZLlj
Protecting our Great Lakes needs to be a national priority. I'm proud to have fought for more funding to clean up our waterways and preserve these unique habitats. https://t.co/fYxLSL58vR
The Trump administration is allowing "junk" insurance plans to flood back into the marketplace. We can't let them continue to undermine our health coverage. https://t.co/5lXayInpNd

Today is an opportunity for us to come together with family and loved ones to take stock of all that we have to be thankful for. I hope that each of you are enjoying time and good food with the special people in your lives. #HappyThanksgiving
As a fifth generation Michigander I know how important the Great Lakes are to our state. I'm making sure we take care of them for generations to come. https://t.co/l5Hz7dTG0y

It is an outrage that Americans who risked their lives for this country are not getting the benefits they have earned. I won't stop demanding answers from the White House until this is fixed. https://t.co/kUWF5QsldH
Congrats to @UMichFootball on a well deserved win today. I know we’ll be back stronger next year. #GoGreen https://t.co/80RK9LwVVY

I've heard from folks all around the state about the rising cost of prescription drugs. I'm working to bring costs down because no one should worry about being able to afford lifesaving medication. https://t.co/fM63gf6Gtr
Your regular reminder that Trump and Republicans are STILL trying to rip away health coverage from millions of Americans. https://t.co/I4gCJLEM4o

Today we thank the brave men and women who donned the uniform in service to our nation. Their sacrifices preserve the freedoms that America was built on and continue to make it great to this day. Let us never fail to honor them for they have truly honored us with their heroism.
Proud to be standing up for Michigan's cherry growers. We need to be cracking down on unfair trade practices and level the playing field for domestic growers. https://t.co/QLKLDHlJ0H
In Michigan the Great Lakes are central to our way of life. I'm making sure we preserve them for generations to come. https://t.co/w0yoboUxUM

Michigan tomorrow is election day! Remember: when you go to the polls make sure you sign up for the permanent absentee ballot list so voting will be even easier in the future. Make your voice heard and vote! https://t.co/qejq64ehkM

This is what happens when you have an administration constantly working to undermine our health coverage. Republicans are literally making it harder for 400000 children to get health care. https://t.co/39QCVyKgeI

I've heard from Michiganders all around the state who are struggling with the rising cost of prescription drugs. It's unacceptable. I'm working to create a more competitive marketplace that brings costs down.   https://t.co/kgO1kgzFG0

This is what a failure in leadership looks like: bombing our own bases abandoning our allies no cohesive strategy. We have to stop making foreign policy decisions with a single tweet and start listening to the experts. Our servicemembers deserve better. https://t.co/GgDISuBLsK
Democrats have a great opportunity to take back the Senate in 2020 but only if we win here in Michigan. Let's make it happen. https://t.co/9Xo0f9QaXV

It's no secret this President is trying to line his pockets with taxpayer dollars. I'm going to continue working to make sure he isn’t boosting his bottom line with your tax dollars. https://t.co/9NfvUzhUCz

This decision reinforces how badly we need to reform our redistricting process. Democracy works when voters can hold politicians accountable and that's precisely why politicians shouldn't be the ones picking their voters. https://t.co/oLFhePI3r9

This judge was "extremely disturbed" that @BetsyDevos would violate a court order to help predatory for-profit colleges. But if you know anything about her long career of weakening protections for students this isn't surprising at all. https://t.co/sW0gxREncW

Michigan is uniquely positioned to lead the way in driving innovation in green energy technologies like electric vehicles and advancing environmental and conservation policies that create 21st century jobs and preserve our Great Lakes for generations to come.

I'm honored to receive the @SierraClub’s endorsement and to stand with such a critical advocate for Michigan and our Great Lakes. I will continue to make sure Michigan is a leader in environmental conservation and addressing the threat of climate change. https://t.co/MH5ESuVuLS

I've heard from folks all over Michigan who are struggling to keep up with the rising cost of prescription drugs. No one should be worried about going bankrupt just for getting sick. I'm working to bring competition to the marketplace and drive costs down. https://t.co/vPFZxptDqw

I’m so grateful for the amazing support our campaign continues to receive from Michiganders all around the state. With your help we had our largest fundraising quarter of the campaign! It's clear Michiganders want effective bipartisan leaders who get the job done. Thank you! https://t.co/8aFWqhyc58

It's great to see so many small businesses rallying around auto workers' fight for fair wages. These workers have sacrificed so much for Michigan and now their communities are standing with them. https://t.co/E1lfymCS6P

Women's health care decisions should be made between her and her doctor. I will continue fighting to make sure every woman across Michigan has the right to make her own medical decisions. I'm honored to be endorsed by @PPAct and #StandWithPP. https://t.co/O6n8aYnoZK

Sen. @Stabenow is absolutely right. The real-world effects of climate change are already hitting Michigan: increased flooding damaged crops spreading of disease. This should be a wakeup call that we need to do more. https://t.co/x7lVKyY4Ix
It makes absolutely no sense that the wealthiest Americans have lower taxes than middle class families. This is why I opposed the #GOPTaxScam   https://t.co/ivXEgtvHrS
We need to be preserving protections for people in Michigan with pre-existing conditions not tearing them down.

Republicans have "no viable plans for replacing critical health benefits for millions of Americans" so they are trying to hide the effects of their dangerous lawsuit until after the next election. https://t.co/rZiqiFOxgZ

Proud to be endorsed by @PPact in this campaign. I remain deeply committed to defending women's access to affordable health care and will always stand up against attacks on reproductive rights. #StandWithPP https://t.co/Y0wsXav7lp

Because we expanded coverage with the ACA Michiganders had fewer health complications during surgery more accurate diagnoses and easier access to important medication. It has saved lives. https://t.co/KelOaLXlWj
The Great Lakes are Michigan's greatest resource. I'm pushing for more  funding so we can protect them for future generations. https://t.co/0rDuGALJ4O

Today also serves as a time to inspire the next generation to follow that important legacy. There are so many great opportunities for students in Michigan to pursue a career in manufacturing. I'm working to make sure we make them available to as many Michiganders as possible.

On Manufacturing Day I thank all the workers who helped make Michigan the hub of U.S. manufacturing and an economic engine for our country. You can't be a truly great nation if you can't make things and thankfully in Michigan we've got the best workers in the world.
There's no question about it: we have to take back the Senate in 2020. That happens by making sure we win right here in Michigan. https://t.co/gBKrpDDq7h

Folks in the skilled trades literally built America. Now they're a big part of the economic growth happening in Detroit. This is exactly why I'm so focused on expanding training programs to get more workers the skills they need. https://t.co/v7OsKlG6r0

I've heard countless stories from Michiganders who were finally able to get the health care they needed because of the Affordable Care Act. It has saved lives. Now we've got to stand up to those trying to tear it down. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/KelOaLXlWj
It's not just the weather climate change will affect us in many more ways than we think. We can't afford inaction. https://t.co/EpQ8IaTek2

Fighting invasive species is absolutely necessary to protect the Great Lakes and the ecosystems they support. I'll always make sure Michigan has the resources we need to continue to preserve our lakes. https://t.co/gbAnKYBQrq

This is very encouraging. There are plenty of great jobs in the skilled trades available right now. I'm especially glad to see programs are helping more women who are vastly underrepresented in these industries get the training they need to fill them. https://t.co/2alGcIxUeS
Shanah Tovah to everyone in Michigan and around the world celebrating #RoshHashanah. I hope you all have a sweet and happy new year!

Thanks @brianschatz I couldn’t agree more. We must take back the Senate and the road to a majority runs right though Michigan. Together we’re going to make sure this seat stays blue. Join our campaign here —> https://t.co/NJac5X5dFm https://t.co/HDhn0rCJI3
PFAS contamination is a serious health risk. I'm working to fix it. This is about protecting service members firefighters and our water for generations to come. https://t.co/oH3e8vVtMn

Today marks two years since President Trump and Republicans unveiled their tax giveaway to giant corporations and billionaires that hiked the deficit and left the middle class to foot the bill. https://t.co/iXvHBlGnVl

A friendly reminder that Trump and his fellow Republicans are in court trying to gut the ACA and end protections for people with pre-existing conditions. There is no "plan" beyond that. https://t.co/JZ2KrOVFPZ

It seems like every day we find out a new way that climate change is threatening the Great Lakes and the industries they support. That will continue if we don't take action immediately. https://t.co/hOMg6mFCOp

And this isn't only about what's happened in the past it's also about the future. The next generation of auto workers deserve the same fair shot at making the middle class that workers had in the past. That comes with fair wages and benefits.

We must not forget that @UAW workers sacrificed a great deal when the auto industry was going through tough times and they played a key role in its comeback. I stand with the workers as they fight for better wages and stronger benefits. https://t.co/2YIlOLtlA5
Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans need to do their job and let us vote. #EnoughIsEnough https://t.co/K3GxKWjtyH

We may have been shaken that day but in the years since America has shown that when we are united we can emerge from our darkest moments even stronger. I carry that sentiment with me to this day and will continue to work towards building a stronger and more united nation.

Today on the anniversary of one our nation's greatest tragedies we honor the first responders and mourn for the victims and their loved ones. I'm also thinking of those serving around the world who continue to sacrifice every day for our freedom. #NeverForget

This is why the fight for the Senate is so important. Republicans will continue to try to strip insurance and health care protections away from millions of Americans. We can't let them win. https://t.co/i4O9Gl2tl1
This flooding is just the beginning. If we want to preserve our Great Lakes and the communities that surround them we have to address climate change.  https://t.co/PaJzqyi8KC

Words and pictures can never fully capture the beauty of Northern Michigan but this article comes close 👇 https://t.co/LYNQt06GbT

The vast majority of Americans agree we need to implement commonsense measures to expand background checks. How many more of these stories do we need to hear before Senate Republicans do their job and let us vote?

The shooter in Odessa who was deemed by a court to be mentally unfit to own a firearm used a loophole to purchase a gun without a background check. Enough is enough. We must close the loopholes and expand background checks. It will save lives. https://t.co/Io8rMI8eP7

People in the skilled trades literally build America. That's why I'm so committed to empowering those who pursue careers in the skilled trades because ALL of our kids should have opportunities to succeed.  https://t.co/P6ro7BIWqE

From the very beginning this administration has tried to make it harder for Americans to get health coverage. As long as they keep this up I'll keep fighting to bring down costs and #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/htvayx9q4N
Team Peters was out in full force this morning! Great to celebrate Labor Day with so many of our amazing volunteers. https://t.co/GJvqlIi2UC

Had a great day riding in the Detroit Labor Day Parade celebrating the important progress the labor community has made on behalf workers everywhere. Unions built Michigan's middle class and continue to be the reason why we have the best workers in the world! https://t.co/QPYLQ3lWYv
Great to see the Detroit Zoo is transitioning to 100% Michigan-made renewable energy by 2021. A great example that a more sustainable future is possible when we take action. https://t.co/PUEwLRFRzx
What a run! @DYCOfficial we’re so proud of you in Michigan.  https://t.co/jgOzU7GyzE
We know the road to the Senate majority runs through Michigan. With your help I know we will keep this seat blue. Join our team here: https://t.co/NJac5X5dFm https://t.co/FIOTXwX7vI
I'm proud to have @StopBigMoney's endorsement in this race. Together we'll continue to work to get dark money out of our elections. Our democracy is worth fighting for!  https://t.co/grZYqpmo53

The Citizens United decision let out-of-state billionaires hide behind dark money organizations and try to silence the voice of MI voters. I've supported efforts to reform our campaign finance system and improve transparency in our elections. Glad to have @StopBigMoney's support! https://t.co/YHlIS2jROo

It's incredibly frustrating to see our cherry farmers hurt by unfair trade practices from foreign competitors. I'm working to level the playing field and stand up for MI farmers.   https://t.co/r8Vc2ZCtnD
Michiganders want workhorses not show horses in the the Senate. I'm fighting everyday to get things done for Michigan. https://t.co/4owrD4z6Xf

The impact of climate change is being felt here in Michigan and around the country. We have a tremendous opportunity to both innovate our economy and preserve our environment but we have to act now. https://t.co/y7tDzlLfGo
I want to wish a very Happy Birthday to @GretchenWhitmer! She's a terrific leader for our state and an even better friend. Have a great day Governor! https://t.co/C11U7NWY9i
Here in Michigan we build things and our workers can outcompete anyone. Always good to see more investment in Michigan manufacturing.  https://t.co/7lQ5B4UreL

For years Republicans in Washington have tried their hardest to take me out and they’re going to try again in 2020. It hasn’t worked before and if we all fight together I know we can win this seat and continue delivering for Michigan.  https://t.co/r0odchV1Kq
If we’re going to win back the Senate in 2020 we’ve got to win here in Michigan. I’ve never backed down from a tough fight before and I don’t plan on starting now.

Since the day I got to the Senate I’ve been a workhorse for Michigan laser-focused on the issues that we care about here: protecting our health care expanding job training and defending the Great Lakes. I’ll never stop fighting for the state I love. https://t.co/r0odchV1Kq
This is what happens when Congressional Republicans give giant corporations and billionaires a huge tax break—while leaving our children and grandchildren to foot the bill.   https://t.co/WJ3VGNmyRV
Climate change will have serious consequences for the Great Lakes & our economy. We need to address climate change as an economic opportunity to protect Michigan's future.   https://t.co/9ptnChtCez

It's hard to have health care "wins" when your administration repeatedly tries to undermine protections for people with pre-existing conditions and increase costs. https://t.co/Mv2RyTIbJn
This is a real threat to the future of our Great Lakes. We need to keep working to protect them from invasive species and other dangers to the natural ecosystem.  https://t.co/oe8G7u4TWk
Republicans are openly plotting to undo health care protections and increase costs for millions of Americans. We can't let them succeed. We have to win the Senate in 2020. https://t.co/x8idRYJXYs

Instead of standing up for students Secretary DeVos has repeatedly sided with predatory for-profit colleges. Good to see students who were taken advantage of are fighting back.  https://t.co/Ww7rPJkiPR
It's simple. We have to take back the Senate. We have to win in Michigan.   https://t.co/HNdE1sFXfY

The erosion of reproductive rights is already happening and it could get a lot worse. I'll never stop fighting to make sure these decisions remain between a woman and her doctor. https://t.co/QEKfZ1ygvK
Glad to see our state taking steps towards a more sustainable future. Protecting our climate must be a priority and it's going to take all of us to make it happen. https://t.co/EWguz8lviJ

July was the warmest month the world has experienced since record-keeping began more than a century ago.   Our climate isn't going to wait for us to get our act together these dramatic changes are happening all around us right now.   https://t.co/c9tdrsvIox
Weeks like this remind us just how important it is for Democrats to take back the Senate in 2020. We can't do that without winning here in Michigan. https://t.co/X4FuI2mmkd

No matter how many times they try to re-brand it the GOP health care agenda has been the same for years: less coverage weaker protections for people with pre-existing conditions and higher costs. I doubt this will be any different. https://t.co/AxJYpp03g2
It was great to be in Ann Arbor celebrating Pride this past weekend! 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍🌈 https://t.co/MOK8vAgA5G
Many communities across Michigan are holding primary elections today. Find your polling place here: https://t.co/DJyfu8WojU

There are commonsense steps that we could be taking right now to curb gun violence but Mitch McConnell and Senate Republicans have prevented us from even voting on them. We can't wait any longer. The time for action is NOW. #EnoughIsEnough
And it's not just about the horrific incidents we see in the national news. Families are torn apart by gun violence every single day. It kills more than 36000 Americans a year.

I am heartbroken for the victims and affected families in El Paso and Dayton. If two mass shootings in less than 24 hours doesn't convince you that we need to do more as a country to combat gun violence I don't know what will. This is an epidemic.
The threat of climate change touches so many parts of our lives from worsening air and water quality to damaging our crops and infrastructure. These issues affect us all. https://t.co/922lU9At5I
Mitch McConnell's decision to play politics with the security our democracy is shameful. Election security shouldn't be a partisan issue. https://t.co/QUYFfJcDVB

The idea that the richest Americans need another tax cut - after the GOP just gave one to billionaires and large corporations - is ridiculous. I'll keep fighting to make sure the middle class gets a fair shake. https://t.co/rVi3bA8bcy

Great to have the Democratic candidates in Michigan these last few days talking to voters and hearing the issues they care most about. I've said it before and I'll say it again: The road to the White House runs through MI. Our voters and their concerns MUST be a priority.

Michigan voters and their concerns can't be taken for granted. They want to hear about how we can ensure workers get the skills to find good-paying job lower prescription drug costs and protect our Great Lakes. These are the issues I hear about every day. https://t.co/tlVfAwXUwR
The road to the White House runs through Michigan. I went on @NewDay to discuss what I think our nominee needs to talk about to win here in 2020. https://t.co/DFcKIXYLFC
Same story different day: @BetsyDeVos's team got caught giving special treatment to for-profit colleges instead of fighting for the students who they took advantage of. https://t.co/e55O0RaM0b

Every day I'm laser-focused on working to deliver for Michigan families. So I wrote a letter outlining what I believe any candidate must talk about to be successful in our state. Read it here: https://t.co/tlVfAwXUwR

I'm glad the presidential debates are coming to Detroit next week. The road to the White House runs through MI.   I hope the candidates will take this opportunity to hear from Michiganders about the issues that are most important to them. https://t.co/2Oz3jTR6ie
That should be concerning to everyone. We must take action to protect our national security & safeguard our elections.

It was important that Special Counsel Mueller testified so the American people could hear the facts directly from him. He yet again reiterated that a foreign government made deliberate and sweeping attempts to interfere in our democracy.
Michigan can never be taken for granted. Our voters and our issues must be a priority. The road to the White House runs through MI so I hope the candidates will be here early and often. Good Luck!

Our nominee must recognize that MI's diversity is its greatest strength. Communities across our state have felt the sting of discrimination under the current administration. I urge the candidates to fight to reverse their discriminatory policies and stand up for all Michiganders.

Michiganders are feeling the squeeze of rising health care costs especially prescription drug prices. Some even cross the border into Canada to seek out lower prices for life-saving medications. I hope to hear their plans to reverse this trend.

If given a fair shot Michigan's workers can outcompete anyone. I hope to hear how they will fight for working families strengthen unions and expand job training to make sure anyone can get the skills they need to find a good-paying job.
We have no more important resource in Michigan than our water. It is central to our way of life. I hope the candidates talk about protecting our Great Lakes and ensuring clean drinking water.

I’m very excited that the Democratic candidates are coming to Detroit for next week's presidential debates. I wrote an open letter to them about some key issues I believe our nominee must address to win Michigan. You can read it here: https://t.co/tlVfAwXUwR
The rising cost of prescription drugs is having deadly consequences. No one should be forced to ration the medicines they need like insulin due to drug company price-gouging. https://t.co/qyygBLNTsL

As reproductive rights are under attack around the country and here in MI this is an important reminder that those restrictions hit our most vulnerable communities the hardest. https://t.co/492vYBov9D
This perfectly captures what makes our Great Lakes so special: their majesty and central importance to our way of life. https://t.co/r96gpgDMSR
Thanks again to everyone who contributed to our campaign. Together we're going to make sure Michigan stays blue next year! https://t.co/r3B0WW5Ij2

The kind of problems we're seeing now because of  high lake levels and abundant spring rainfall give a hint to what Michigan will endure from full-blown climate change one day. https://t.co/u5XUeBsuU4
It's so important that we take back the Senate in 2020. But to do that we have to make sure Michigan stays blue. https://t.co/Zf9xSpxcOv

The GOP health care plan: higher costs and worse coverage. We need to hold them accountable for once again jeopardizing health care protections for millions in Michigan and around the country. https://t.co/qkxv6X4Klp
